text:
News Former prostitute who began selling sex at 14 bravely speaks out about escaping seedy underworld 'Sarah' was forced to walk the streets by her drug-addict boyfriend, she was exposed to a violent world that still haunts her today Share 'Sarah' has spoken out about her ordeals (stock image) Share Get daily   
A former prostitute who started selling sex at 14 has bravely spoken out about how she escaped the seedy underworld. 
'Sarah' was forced to walk the streets by her drug-addict boyfriend, she was exposed to a violent world that still haunts her today. 
During her years on the game she had a knife put to her throat, a brick wrapped around her head and beaten with such ferocity she feared she would die. 
“If I didn’t do what he said, then either he would kick me to bits or the guys I was forced to sleep with would,” said Sarah, which isn’t her real name. 
She said she only escaped with the help of the charity Barnardo's, the Gazette reports . Read More 70 people found living in one house guarded by balaclava wearing 'caretaker' as landlord earned £2,100 each week 
“Basically my boyfriend wanted money for drugs, and used me to get that money,” said Sarah. 
“It started off with him giving me to a bloke who he said was a friend, but he wasn’t a friend he was a drug dealer. 
“He said that if I loved him, I would sleep with another man for him.” 
She said at first the man, who was in his 20s, promised her the Earth. 
But in just six months, he had used cruel mind games on her - crushing her self-esteem - until she was walking Yarm Road solely to fund his addition. 
“I didn’t look 14, but I was really shy and I didn’t know what to say to these men - I didn’t want to be sleeping with these people.” She was pimped out by her own boyfriend (stock image) 
When she wasn’t seeing customers, she was facing more and more cruelty from the boyfriend - who had become her pimp. 
“He would tell me that nobody else would touch me and he just played with my head until I didn’t know any better,” said Sarah, who is now in her 20s. 
“At one stage I had a knife to my throat and then I had a brick over my head.” 
An extract from her diary, dated June 17, states: “Another night on the streets, three of them again - he doesn’t care, just wants his fix. 
“He called me ugly and worthless maybe he’s right. 
“I do wish they would stop hurting me though, I can do that myself sometimes. 
“I think they will kill me off.” Read More Woman posed as teenage girl on Facebook to entice young boys to perform sex acts 
It was about two years later when, tears streaming down her face, she approached Barnardo's. 
The charity, over time, helped her escape. She never told the police about her boyfriend but he eventually disappeared. 
But for Sarah, she said the biggest problem in escaping comes after sex workers reach out for help. 
Sarah has since gone on to get a degree, but for others just finding work can be impossible. 
“The hard part is filling in those gaps on your CV - how do you explain you haven’t had a real job for ten years?” she said. Like us on Facebook
